That was when I knew my business could work, and I decided to create a website. Since then, I have made a lot of money from my business, mostly online, but we still have our stall. It has been a lot of fun!"

'When Janine Stuart was 13 years old, she wrote a book called Being Amelia. This book became very popular. Being Amelia is partly about Janine’s life. In an interview, Janine said, “Because my father’s job made us move a lot, I learned to make new friends. I know what it is like to be the new student in a class. This helped me write about Amelia, the main character, who starts at a new school. Some funny parts of the book are about Amelia’s home life, especially with her older brother. I am an only child, so I had to use my imagination to write about that.” 
Janine started her book one summer when she was bored at home. Her mother wanted to be a writer, and her teachers encouraged her to write too. So, writing was a good way for Janine to spend her time. The year before, she won a short story competition on a young writers’ website. That is why, when Janine finished Being Amelia and sent it to a publishing company, they were excited to read it. They loved it, and a year later, Janine’s book was in stores. 
One review of Being Amelia says that even though the cover shows happy teenagers, the characters face some hard problems. This makes readers believe in them. The reviewer says that even if Janine is young and her book is not very long, she is a better writer than many other famous authors. Janine is still getting used to being a famous writer. She said, “At first, I hid when people saw me in the street, but now it’s OK. I want to help other young writers, but they need to find their own way. For me, I just need to spend time with my friends, and then I will have something interesting to write about!”'

"My name is Tom. I am fifteen years old. Three years ago, my family and I moved to a castle on a small island. My father got a job as the manager of the castle. He works for a group that takes care of old buildings and keeps them open for visitors. He was happy to get this job, but it took some time for the rest of us to agree. We were worried about living on the island. We thought the castle might not be as nice as our warm home across the water, and there was no school there. 
After we moved, we got used to life on the island. The castle is not very beautiful, but our apartment is comfortable. In summer, the island is friendly and has many visitors. There are often parties on the beach. In winter, we only see the other families who live on the island, and there are not many teenagers. The adults help each other with work on the island, which can be hard.
The biggest change for me was taking a boat to my old school every day. I was excited to go on stormy days when there are big waves, but the ferries do not run then! I also learned that if I miss the bus to the harbor after school, I miss the last ferry home, which is scary. So, when my friends come to visit, I always tell them to hurry! 
We often see beautiful views, especially when the sun sets over the sea. Some days, it is so foggy that you cannot see anything, but then it can be sunny again in a few hours. It is still amazing to see this, even after living here for a long time. We do have bad storms, and I sometimes wonder if the castle is strong enough. But I remember it has been here for many years, and it is still standing!"

"I live in a house in the beautiful countryside of Scotland. I love nature and wild animals. Six years ago, I started a new hobby – birdwatching! I went to the mountains in northern Scotland with my family. We saw many birds in their natural homes. I spent hours watching them with my parents. They taught me how to tell different types of birds apart and where to find them. It was amazing! After that, I joined a local birdwatchers’ club for young people. My goal is to see 200 different types of birds. I am almost there because I have seen birds from other countries on family holidays. We always look for places with birdwatching activities so I can add new birds to my list! I have been to Egypt, and last summer we went to South America. I thought I would see my 200th bird there, but it didn’t happen. I learned that you need to be patient with this hobby. I made a video about my birdwatching challenge, and many teenagers liked it and said it looked fun. When my teachers saw it, they asked me to talk about birdwatching at school. I felt nervous before I went on stage, but I remembered what to say and had notes to help me. The whole school and my friends were watching! I relaxed when it was over, and the teachers said I did well. I might do another presentation next year! I am lucky to live in the countryside. I understand why many teenagers in cities might not want to be birdwatchers, but there are many birds to see in green areas. I think birdwatching clubs should try to get more young people interested in this hobby. Everyone should connect with nature, no matter how old they are, and it doesn’t have to cost a lot of money."

"I started playing football when I was 7 years old. I would hurry home from school to play with other kids. I loved it, and after some time, I became a good player. My family knew I liked to try new hobbies but then stop them, so they thought I would stop playing football too. But I didn’t. I dreamed of playing football professionally when I grew up. The chance came sooner than I thought. I played in local tournaments, and one referee saw that I was a good player. He told the manager of a women’s club to watch me play. After that, she asked me to join her club. I was surprised because I didn’t know young girls could join women’s clubs. But the manager liked me, and I started training with a big club when I was 13 years old. I got much better after that. Still, some people were not sure I would be a star player, which made me a little sad. But my coach told me to be myself and believe in myself. He even let me play in an important match earlier than I thought! I ran very hard because I didn’t want to let my team down. Then, by chance, I scored the winning goal! Even with many fans watching, I could hear my coach cheering for me. After the match, my team carried me around the field. It was amazing! Since then, I have scored many more winning goals! Next month, my coach and I are organizing a football tournament in my area. The goal is to get teenagers interested in football and let them meet other players in my club. They will see what it is like to be in a professional team and feel they can play for a top team if they work hard. My advice to them will be the same as my coach told me – there will be good times and bad times too. I have had very few bad times, so I feel lucky!"

In the UK and other countries, there is a new idea in schools and universities. This idea is to help new students start doing research early in their studies. Research is not just for famous scholars or scientists. It is a way for everyone to learn and build skills. Research skills are important for studying and for jobs because they help us think about the world and do our work better.
As a student, you can help create knowledge. You do not just learn and repeat what others say; you ask questions. You might wonder: Why? How? When? What does this mean? What if things were different? These questions are important for research. 
Research can be very complex, but it can also be simple. At the simple end, research is about asking questions and looking for answers. Most students have done some research before. You have probably asked questions for school projects or at work. You have also done research when planning a holiday, growing plants, fixing things at home, training your dog, or shopping online.
In college and university, you are expected to ask questions, think critically, and explore information. Some students find this hard because in some cultures, knowledge is seen as fixed. They may think it is wrong to question what teachers or books say. However, in many places like the UK, US, and Europe, it is important to question knowledge and those who teach it.
Doing research can feel challenging. Critical thinking is very important. We should not just repeat what we read or hear. Instead, we need to think about it, test it, and see if it makes sense. We should not just accept everything as true without questioning it.

Cities have always been important places for ideas and discussions. In the 18th century, people in London met in coffee houses to talk about science and politics. In modern Paris, artist Pablo Picasso talked about art in cafés. However, living in a city can be hard. The same cafés in London that helped people talk also spread diseases like cholera. Picasso eventually moved to the countryside. 
Today, cities are full of creativity, but they can also feel overwhelming. Scientists are studying how city life affects our brains, and they found some surprising results. City life can be tiring, and it can make it harder for us to think clearly. One reason for this is that cities lack nature. Research shows that hospital patients get better faster when they can see trees from their windows. Even a little bit of nature can help our brains relax and work better.
More people now live in cities than in the countryside. Instead of having open spaces, we live in crowded areas with many strangers. This crowded life can affect our mental and physical health. When we walk in busy streets, our brains have to pay attention to many things, like other people and traffic. This can make us feel tired because our brains are always working hard to focus.
Natural places are easier for our brains. This idea is called attention restoration theory, created by psychologist Stephen Kaplan. He believed that being in nature helps our brains recover. Nature has things that catch our attention without causing stress, unlike loud noises like sirens. When we are in nature, our brains can relax and recharge.
Before scientists studied this, philosophers and city planners warned about the problems of city life and wanted to add more nature to cities. Parks, like Central Park in New York, give people a break from city life. A good park can help our brains feel better quickly. Many people look for ways to improve their thinking, but walking in nature is one of the best ways.
Despite the problems of city life, cities keep growing. Research shows that crowded streets can also lead to new ideas and creativity. The many social interactions in cities help people be creative. Just like the crowded streets of 18th-century London led to new ideas, the busy areas of today’s cities can also help with innovation. 
The challenge is to find ways to reduce the stress of city life while keeping its benefits. Sometimes, people feel tired of nature and want to go back to the city! 
**Questions:**

Where should we look for the mind? This question may seem strange because we usually think that thinking happens inside our heads. Today, we have advanced machines that can show us brain activity. However, I believe that studying the mind should not only focus on what is inside our heads. There is a lot of evidence from history that shows that objects and tools also help us think. For example, things like stone tools, jewelry, drawings, and writing have played an important role in how humans have developed their minds.
Many scientists study the mind by looking at people without the things they usually use. This is helpful for understanding the brain, but it can make us forget that we often think with the help of things around us. I do not want to say that the brain is not important, but I want to show that the mind is more than just the brain. It is useful to think about how human intelligence connects with culture and the things we use.
I have a new idea called Material Engagement Theory (MET). This theory looks at how objects can help us think. For example, when someone makes numbers from clay or uses a stone to create a tool, these actions show how things can help our minds. MET also studies how this relationship has changed over time and what it means for our thinking.
Think about a blind person using a stick. Where does this person’s self begin? The blind person and the stick work together, showing that minds and things can be connected. The stick helps the blind person feel their surroundings, and the brain sees the stick as part of the body. This example reminds us that human intelligence can change and grow when we use new tools and technology.
I see the human mind as something that is always changing and developing. No matter what tools we have used throughout history, like stone tools or the internet, they help us understand the world and move forward. For humans, tools are not just for getting food; they help us learn and explore. This special ability to use objects to think is why humans create things more than any other species. I call this ability metaplasticity, which means our minds can change as we interact with the world around us.
MET helps us understand how different tools, from ancient hand-axes to modern smartphones, can change who we are and how we think. While the idea of technology changing our minds may sound like science fiction, humans have been using it since the beginning of our existence.
**Questions:**
1. What is the main question the text asks about the mind?
2. What does the author believe about studying the mind?
3. What is Material Engagement Theory (MET)?
4. Give an example of how a blind person uses a stick.
5. What does the author mean by "metaplasticity"?

Photography is an important invention that has changed how we see the world. In the United States, photography became a big part of culture. It is used in many ways, like science, industry, and art, and it also brings fun and entertainment. Historians say that photography is one of the greatest contributions of the US to visual arts. 
Photography became popular in the mid-19th century. People liked it because it used machines, which matched their interest in technology. Just like trains and electricity made travel easier, photography brought images of the world into homes quickly. The camera helped people show their identity and share images of themselves and their families. It created a record of family life, even if it was not always perfect. 
Photographs are realistic and connect with the art of showing everyday life. Each photograph tells us to look at something special. Because photographs are made by machines, they are seen as records of real events, people, and things. However, the person taking the photo also gives their own view, which can change how we understand the image. 
People often think they know what a photograph means, but it can be more complicated. The meaning of a photograph can change based on where and how we see it. To understand a photograph, we should think about why the photographer took it and how people first saw it. 
In recent years, artists have used photographs in their work in many ways. For example, artist Andy Warhol used photographs in his paintings. Now, photography is seen as an important part of art, not just separate from painting.

In 1890, William James, an American philosopher and doctor, defined psychology as the "science of mental life." This definition helps us understand psychology today. Everyone has a mental life, which means we have thoughts and feelings. We can study these in humans, rats, and monkeys, but it can be hard to understand.
William James was interested in human psychology. He believed it has basic parts: thoughts, feelings, and the physical world around us. Our knowledge about these things is personal and comes from our own experiences. Sometimes, we think we know why people act in certain ways, like feeling insulted or unhappy. But when two people understand things differently, it can cause problems.
Psychology tries to find the best explanations for different situations. Psychologists help us tell the difference between our personal thoughts and scientific facts. They study the mind and brain, but they do not know everything about how the brain works. They learn more by observing our behavior and making guesses about what happens inside us.
Studying psychology is like solving a crossword puzzle. It requires careful observation and logical thinking. Psychologists want to describe, understand, predict, and change behaviors. When they achieve these goals, they can help us understand our experiences and improve our lives.
Psychological research has helped in many areas, like teaching children to read better, designing safer machines, and helping people express their feelings when they are sad. Although people have talked about psychology for a long time, it has only been studied scientifically for about 150 years. Early psychologists looked at their own thoughts to find answers, but this method has limitations. Today, psychologists prefer to observe the behavior of others to develop their theories.

In a storehouse in a business park in Michigan, USA, there is a special place called the Museum of Failed Products. This museum has many products that people did not want to buy. Some examples are A Touch of Yogurt shampoo and Breakfast Cola. The museum is owned by a company called GfK. Carol Sherry, who runs the museum, believes that each product has a sad story about the people who tried to sell it.
The museum is surprising because it makes money. Many companies do not keep samples of their failed products. They do not want to think about their failures. The museum started by accident. Robert McMath, a former marketing worker, wanted to collect new products, not just the failed ones. He began buying every new item he could find in the 1960s. He did not realize that most products fail. Because of this, he ended up with many failed products in his collection.
Today, many people are very positive and think good things will happen. This can lead to products being made that are not successful. People often have meetings where they do not see that a product will fail. Sometimes, marketers spend more money on a bad product to try to make it sell better. They do not want to talk about what went wrong.
In the self-help world, there is a popular idea called "positive visualization." This means if you think about good things happening, they are more likely to happen. Some scientists, like Tali Sharot, believe that our brains are made to see things positively. However, thinking too much about good outcomes can actually make people less motivated to reach their goals. 
Psychologist Gabriele Oettingen found that when people spend time imagining how well things will go, they often do worse in real life. Carol Dweck, another psychologist, says that how we see failure depends on our beliefs about ability. Some people think ability is something you are born with, while others believe it can grow with effort. People who think ability is fixed feel very bad about failing. For example, a sports star who thinks he is a natural talent may not practice enough and then fail. On the other hand, people who believe ability can grow see failure as a chance to learn and improve. Dweck compares this to weight training, where muscles get stronger by being pushed to their limits. Having a growth mindset is a happier way to live, whether or not it leads to success.
**Questions:**
1. What is the name of the museum in Michigan?
2. Who owns the Museum of Failed Products?
3. What did Robert McMath want to collect in the 1960s?
4. What is "positive visualization"?
5. How do people with a fixed mindset feel about failure?

Everyone knows that sports teams often do better when they play at home. But why is this? Many people think they know the answer, but professional sports are changing quickly, and we are starting to question what we thought was true. Two main reasons for this are science and money. Sports scientists want to understand how players can play their best, and they have many ideas about home advantage. At the same time, people who invest money in sports want to know why home advantage is important. If players are paid well, shouldn’t they feel good playing anywhere?
What about the fans? Would it matter if a team like Manchester United played some of their home games far away, like in Asia, to reach more fans? It would matter to British fans who believe their team needs their support and energy. Fans often think that if they cheer loudly, their team will score. They remember the times when they cheered and a goal was scored, but they forget the times when their cheering did not help.
There is one idea that seems to be true based on science. Home fans not only cheer for their team but also shout at the referee. In a study, referees watched a game with crowd noise and another game in silence. The referees who heard the crowd were less likely to call fouls against the home team. This means referees try to avoid making calls that would upset the home fans.
Recent studies show that home advantage has become less important in many sports, but not as much as we might think. For example, in the 1890s, home teams in England won about 70% of the points, but now they win about 60%. One reason for this change is travel. In the past, traveling was hard, but now players travel in comfort. Also, stadiums look more similar now, which may affect home advantage.
Different sports have different levels of home advantage. Basketball has the most home advantage, followed by football, while baseball has the least. This might be because baseball is more about individual players, while basketball is about teamwork. In basketball, players feel more confident when they play at home, which helps them play better.
Another interesting point is that players have higher testosterone levels before home games. This might be because they want to protect their home ground. In some recent Rugby World Cup games, underdog teams won at home against stronger teams, showing the power of home advantage. As one referee said, "It’s the law of the jungle out there."
**Questions:**
1. Why do sports teams often do better at home?
2. What do sports scientists want to understand?
3. How did referees react to crowd noise during the study?
4. How has home advantage changed in sports over time?
5. Which sport has the most home advantage? Which has the least?

"The more I practice, the luckier I get," said golfer Gary Player many years ago. This saying is famous in sports and is important for many athletes and their coaches. It is easy to understand why. First, many people argue about who really said it first. Second, the meaning is not clear. Player did not mean "lucky" in a real way; he was being funny. His real message was: "The more I practice, the better I get." 
This idea connects to a big question: Is talent something you are born with, or can you learn it? Many people believe that practice is more important than natural talent. Psychologist Anders Ericsson is known for saying that you need 10,000 hours of practice to become an expert in anything. Many books, like Malcolm Gladwell’s "Outliers," support this idea. They say that practice is what really matters.
However, author Epstein argues that this is not always true. He points out a problem with many studies about successful people: they often only look at the best athletes. He asks if there are other ways to understand why some people have special skills while others do not. Epstein travels around the world to find answers, from Kenya to Sweden and beyond. 
In Alaska, he learns that the best sled dogs might win because of their strong desire to run. This shows that both genes and choices can be important. Some people think that determination is a choice, but Epstein wonders if it can also come from our genes. 
He talks about the difference between "hardware" (nature) and "software" (nurture). He believes that both are important for top athletes. For example, if Usain Bolt had grown up in the US, he might have been a good basketball player instead of the fastest man in the world. 
Epstein also discusses race and gender in sports. He asks, "If only practice matters, why do we have separate competitions for men and women?" Sometimes, the best questions are the simplest ones.

A new report says that many children in rich countries feel lonely and unhappy. Jay Griffiths asks why children today are not happy. In her book, Kith, she explains that many children stay inside too much. They spend a lot of time in front of screens, like TVs and computers, and they do not play outside in nature anymore. Griffiths believes this is a big problem.
A follow-up study talked to some children to understand their feelings better. The children did not say they wanted more new technology. Many said they would be happier if they could go outside more. Older people often remember their childhoods fondly. They talk about how they played outside, explored, and had fun in nature. They think this was better than how children live today. However, they forget that they are the ones who keep their children safe and do not let them play outside as much.
Griffiths discusses how parents worry about dangers outside. This worry makes them keep their children at home. Because of this, toy and gadget companies sell more products to keep children entertained indoors. She also talks about how some children are given medicine for being restless or how they must wear goggles to play games. Some of these rules may not be very common, but Griffiths feels strongly about them.
While Griffiths has good ideas, she sometimes goes too far. She compares how we treat children today to racism, which seems extreme. She believes children should have the freedom to explore and take risks. She says children need to have small accidents to learn how to be safe later. However, she does not explain how to let children have these small accidents safely. 
Not all children want to play outside or take risks. Some children are shy or prefer to stay at home. Maybe the real problem is that we try to make all children act the same way, whether we keep them inside or push them outside. 
**Questions:**
1. What does the report say about children in rich countries?
2. Why does Jay Griffiths think children are unhappy?
3. What do many children say would make them happier?
4. How do older people remember their childhoods?
5. What does Griffiths say about parents and their worries?
6. What does Griffiths believe children need to learn about safety? 
7. Why might some children not want to play outside?

I am a bio-psychologist with a PhD, which means I have studied a lot. I am good at solving problems in my work and life, but this is not just because of my education. Many problems in life cannot be solved with complicated formulas or answers we learn in school. They need good judgment, wisdom, and creativity that come from life experiences. For children, these experiences happen during play.
My recent research is about how important play is for children’s growth. All young animals, including humans, play when they are young. Animals that need to learn more play more. For example, meat-eating animals play more than plant-eating animals because hunting is harder to learn than eating grass. Primates, like monkeys and apes, play more than other animals because they need to learn more.
Children play a lot because they have much to learn. Play is how both adults and young animals have always learned. The most important skills children need to live happy and good lives cannot be taught in school. These skills are learned and practiced through play. They include thinking creatively, getting along with others, and controlling their feelings.
Creativity is very important for success. We do not need people who just follow orders or do simple calculations. We need people who can ask new questions and solve new problems. If we can help people think ahead and find solutions, we will have a strong workforce. But this needs creative thinking. Creative people often have a playful mind.
Some adults, called geniuses, keep their childlike ability to play and think creatively. For example, Albert Einstein said that school almost made him lose his love for math and science, but he found it again after school. He called his creative work “combinatorial play.” He imagined chasing a sunbeam and thought about what would happen.
We cannot teach creativity, but school can take it away by focusing on questions that have only one right answer. It is also very important to get along with others, care for them, and work together. Children naturally want to play with other children, and through play, they learn social skills and fairness, which they need for life.
Play is voluntary, which means players can stop whenever they want. If you cannot stop, it is not play. Players know they must keep each other happy to keep playing. This makes play a very fair activity.
However, school has become harder. There are fewer breaks, more homework, and more pressure for good grades. Organized sports have taken the place of free play. “Play dates” with adults have replaced playing outside with friends, and adults often feel they must help instead of letting children solve their own problems.
These changes have happened slowly but are very big. They are caused by many social factors, like parents’ fears, warnings from experts, and the idea that children learn more from adults than from each other. Our children do not need more school; they need more play. If we care about our children and the future, we must change this trend. We must let children play and explore so they can grow into strong adults ready for the future.

In many countries, more young people in their twenties are using social media to find jobs. Websites like Twitter and LinkedIn help them connect directly with employers. This is easier than standing outside an office with a big sign that says "hire me." But using social media can also lead to mistakes.
For example, a young man in the US tried to connect with a senior marketing executive on LinkedIn. He thought she could help him find a job because she knew many important people. However, she was upset that he asked her to share her contacts. She rejected his request and sent a very rude message that many people saw online. People were shocked by her message, and she might regret how she wrote it. 
This situation shows that young people need to be careful when using social media for work. Many young people use sites like Facebook and Twitter for fun, but using them for jobs is different. When I was a teenager, social media was a way to escape from parents and teachers. It was a place to show off and be creative. You could talk to someone online for hours and then ignore them at school. You could change how you looked online with pictures and songs.
However, using social media for work is not the same. Some young people still act like they did when they were teenagers. Just because many people liked your posts on Facebook does not mean you will impress employers on LinkedIn. We need to understand that what we learned as teenagers does not work anymore. We must meet employers' expectations to get jobs.
One common complaint from employers is that young job seekers are too casual and seem arrogant. This makes older people think badly of our generation. In reality, many young people are worried about finding jobs, which is why they use social media. This impression of arrogance can hurt their chances, even if they have the skills to do well at work.
So, how should you contact someone on a professional site? First, clearly say who you are and explain how you can help them. This way, you have a better chance of getting a good response. Avoid sending the same message to many people, and keep your tone polite. Remember, social media can help you make important connections, but you need to use it carefully to avoid problems. 
**Questions:**
1. Why are young people using social media to find jobs?
2. What mistake did the young job seeker make when contacting the marketing executive?
3. How was social media used by the writer when they were a teenager?
4. What should you do when contacting someone on a professional networking site?
5. Why is it important to be polite when using social media for work?

It is hard to say what will happen to newspapers in the future. Many people think newspapers are in trouble. Since 2000, the number of people reading UK national newspapers has dropped a lot, by about one-third to one-half. In the USA, a study shows that only 26% of people get their news from newspapers now, down from 45% in 2001. Some people believe that printed newspapers will disappear in 15 years. 
However, history shows that old types of media often survive. For example, in 1835, a journalist said that books and theatre would not be popular anymore, but theatre is still here today. Radio is still popular even with television, and cinema is still around despite videos and DVDs. Even vinyl records are coming back, with online sales increasing a lot since 2008. 
Newspapers were once a new form of media too. It took a long time for them to become the main source of news. This happened because it became easier to share news with many people thanks to new technology in the 19th century, like the steam press and the telegraph. People started to think that they needed to know what was happening around them regularly. In the past, people only noticed changes in the seasons or big disasters like floods or diseases. 
Before the 19th century, journalism was not a job that many people could do for a living. There was no need for news every day or week. Sometimes, having newspapers published regularly can be a problem. Now, people can read news online whenever they want. They can choose what news is important to them. When big news happens, online news can update quickly. Mistakes can be fixed right away, and there are no limits on how much information can be shared. 
But many news providers focus on being the first to share news instead of helping people understand it. In the past, news was shared in busy places like markets or taverns, where truth and rumors mixed together. Today, it seems like we are going back to that way of sharing news. Newspapers have not always done a good job of explaining how the world works. They might disappear, or they might find a way to help us understand better in this confusing world. 
**Questions:**
1. What has happened to the number of people reading UK national newspapers since 2000?
2. What percentage of US citizens get their news from newspapers now?
3. What did a journalist say in 1835 about books and theatre?
4. Why did newspapers take a long time to become popular?
5. How can people read news online today?
6. What is one problem with how news is shared today?

If humans really felt at home under the moon and stars, we would walk happily in the dark. The night would be as clear to us as it is to many animals that are active at night. But we are daytime creatures. Our eyes are made to see in the sunlight. This is a part of our nature, even if we don’t think about it. 
We have changed the night by adding a lot of light. This is similar to building a dam in a river. While there are benefits to this, it also causes problems called light pollution. Light pollution happens because of bad lighting design. This means that artificial light shines up into the sky instead of down where it is needed. Poor lighting makes the night bright, changing the natural light that many living things, including us, are used to. 
When artificial light spreads into nature, it affects many things like migration, reproduction, and feeding. For most of human history, the term ‘light pollution’ did not exist. Imagine walking towards London on a moonlit night in 1800. At that time, nearly a million people lived there, using candles and lanterns. There were only a few gas lights, and no public lights in the streets for another seven years. From far away, you would smell London before you saw its dim light.
We have brightened the night as if it were empty, but that is not true. There are many animals that are active at night. Light is very strong and can attract many animals. Scientists say that some birds are drawn to bright lights, circling around them until they fall. Birds that migrate at night can crash into tall buildings that are brightly lit. Young birds on their first journey are especially affected. Some birds, like blackbirds and nightingales, sing at strange times because of artificial light.
At first, people thought light pollution only bothered astronomers, who need to see the stars clearly. Most of us do not need to see the night sky for our work, but we still need darkness. We cannot ignore darkness. It is just as important for our health as light is. Changing our natural sleep and wake cycles can cause health problems. The way we wake and sleep is connected to the light and dark cycles on Earth. 
These cycles are very important to us. Changing them is like changing our balance. In the end, humans are just as affected by light pollution as frogs living near a bright highway. By living in our own bright lights, we have lost touch with our natural and cultural history – the stars and the natural rhythms of day and night. Light pollution makes us forget our true place in the universe and the beauty of a dark night with the Milky Way above us. 
**Questions:**
1. What do humans need to feel at home at night?
2. What is light pollution?
3. How does light pollution affect animals?
4. Why is darkness important for humans?
5. What happens to birds that migrate at night?

A leader of a big company said that his business will not keep track of how much paid holiday time employees take. He got this idea from a smaller internet company that has a similar rule. The leader said he was inspired by a happy email from his daughter. In the email, she wrote like a professional writer.
Some people think this new rule is not practical. The internet company has 2,000 employees and offers one service. The big company has 50,000 employees and many different services, like finance, transport, and healthcare. The idea of "take as much time off as you want" might work better in a smaller company where workers know each other well. In a big company, it can be hard to know if taking time off will hurt the business.
The leader said employees can take as much leave as they want, but they must be sure their work is done and their team is ready. But is it really possible to be sure? When you come back from a holiday, there is always more work waiting for you. This can make employees feel guilty about taking time off. Feeling guilty can lead to stress, and if workers do not take enough leave, they may not work well in the long run.
There can also be pressure from coworkers about who is taking time off and for how long. In many companies, workers feel they must stay late, and this can create a culture where people do not take holidays. If workers feel they cannot take their leave, they may worry about looking lazy. This can make them feel stuck and not able to take the time off they need.
Technology makes it hard to separate work time from free time. The internet company started their unlimited leave policy because employees wanted to know how to balance work and time off. But if there are no set working hours, employees may feel they are always being watched by their boss. This can make them feel stressed.
Employment laws exist to protect workers. They have the right to a certain amount of paid holiday because rest is important for their health. Good feelings, creativity, and productivity can happen without workers being well-rested. So, I am not sure if the idea of "taking as much holiday as they want" is really what this policy is about or if it will work well. 
**Questions:**
1. What did the leader of the big company decide about holiday time?
2. Where did the leader get the idea for this new rule?
3. How many employees does the internet company have?
4. Why might the new holiday rule be better for a smaller company?
5. What can happen if workers feel guilty about taking time off?
6. Why do employment laws exist?

Peer review is a process where experts check a scientific research paper before it is published. This process is important because it helps to make sure that only good quality papers are published. However, reviewing a paper can take a long time, sometimes up to a year. Some people wonder if this delay is worth it.
Many scientists still believe in peer review, but there are changes happening in how research is published. One change is the use of preprints. Preprints are drafts of papers that are shared online before they are reviewed. This allows other scientists to read and discuss the new research quickly. 
Publishing in journals has become very competitive. Scientists want to publish in well-known journals to help their careers. This competition can sometimes lead to problems, like scientists leaving out important information to make their papers look better. Reviewers also face pressure to decide if a paper is good enough for a journal, rather than if it is good science.
Some scientists, like Ron Vale, think that preprints can help solve these problems. Even though preprints have been around for twenty years, not all scientists use them. Some worry that journals will not accept papers that have been shared as preprints. Others fear that publishing without peer review could lead to bad science. However, preprints allow for open discussion and feedback from other scientists.
Tanya Elks, a psychology professor, shares her experience with preprints. She wrote a paper that criticized another published paper. In the traditional peer review system, the original authors could block her paper. But with preprints, both sides could share their views openly. This way, readers can see all the arguments and decide for themselves.
Preprint archives allow scientists to discuss their work with others around the world. They can also share negative results, which are often ignored by journals that focus only on new discoveries. Papers shared as preprints are read and cited more often, showing that this method works well. By using the internet to share research openly, preprints can help scientists focus on the quality of their work, not just where it is published.
**Questions:**
1. What is peer review?
2. Why can reviewing a paper take a long time?
3. What are preprints?
4. Why do some scientists prefer to use preprints?
5. How do preprints help in scientific discussions?

When I ask my students what a poem is, they often say, "a painting in words." But this answer does not make me happy, and it does not make them happy either. One day, I asked my students to pick an object and write two paragraphs about it. One paragraph was to describe the object like a scientist, and the other was to describe it from the object's point of view. They had to call it "Poem." One student wrote this: 
**Poem**  
I may look strange or scary, but I help people breathe. I am used only in emergencies and for a short time. Most people will never use me. The object? An oxygen mask. This choice helped the class understand how poetry works in a special way. The exercise made us laugh and talk a lot. 
When I was in school, poetry was confusing for me. I thought every poem was a silly puzzle that made it hard to understand feelings. After school, many people pay less attention to poetry. Sometimes you see a poem, and it is different from regular writing. It makes you want to read it, but often you feel let down because it is not interesting or hard to understand. Still, you feel good for trying. 
What do we want from the poems we read? A poem should have deep feelings, beautiful images, and clever thoughts. We might cry while watching a movie, or read an article for information. Novels take us to different worlds, paintings are nice to look at, and music is very special. But poems can be useful in a different way: they can be unclear. Everyday life is often unclear, too. 
If you look up "poem" online, it says it is a type of art that uses the beauty and rhythm of language. This is a fancy way to explain it, but the word "poem" comes from Greek and means "a thing made." A poet is someone who makes things. So, if a poem is a thing made, what kind of thing is it? Some poets say poems are like wild animals – they cannot be controlled – or like machines – they are made carefully. But these ideas do not always work. 
The best part of trying to define a poem is the discussion it creates. Whether you think a poem is a machine or a wild animal, this can change how you think about both. It can help you see everyday things in a new way. 
A poem is not hard to understand, especially if you think about how song lyrics can stay in your mind. The mix of words and music is powerful, like the saying, "Sticks and stones may break my bones, but words can never hurt me." But sometimes, words can hurt. Think about a poem in a newspaper or magazine. A poem can touch your heart like nothing else, even though it is just ink on paper. 
What about the empty space around the poem? This space could be used for a longer article or an ad. A poem is written and rewritten like a story or article, but it is not made to be sold. Publishers send out poetry books, but they do not expect to make money from them. A poem is not just for selling; it is special on its own. Because of this, a poem can still surprise us, even if just for a moment.

I bought my first metal detector after I got married. It cost £70, which was a lot of money at that time. My wife, Marion, was very impressed when I found a gold ring worth £80 on my first trip. Over the years, I have found many things like brooches and coins, and they made me happy. I like feeling connected to the past. 
After the gold ring, it took 40 years before I found something that impressed Marion again. One dull February afternoon, I had some free time and a place to search. It was raining, so I chose a closer spot where I knew there were old farming tools. When my detector beeped for the first time, I found a piece of a metal wheel. Then it beeped again. I tried to ignore it, but I had to check. I dug down half a meter and lay in the mud when I saw a round, golden ball. I had found brass curtain rails before, so I was careful not to get too excited. 
As I cleaned the dirt off, the ball turned into a beautiful, twisted loop. I remembered seeing something like this before at the British Museum. It was called a torc, a famous necklace from Iron Age Britain, over 2,000 years ago. It is made of gold and silver, with gold rings on each end. I took it to my car and looked at it while driving home. I washed it in my kitchen sink, which was probably the only cleaning it had since ancient times. 
“Marion!” I shouted, “I have something for you.” When she came into the room, she stopped and asked, “What is it?” I told her it was a very old and rare piece of jewelry. We didn’t try it on because we didn’t want to damage it. At bedtime, I hid it in our wardrobe. I was worried about it being stolen, so I got up and hid it under a floorboard in my office. 
The law says I must tell the authorities about such finds within 14 days. I wanted to enjoy the torc as much as I could before I gave it away. I even took it in a plastic bag to show a friend in the hospital. Finally, I took it to the council office in the same bag. The registrar was talking to someone when I put the torc on his desk. He turned around and stopped talking. The torc was checked and later sold to my local council. It is now in the British Museum in London. 
I received £350,000 from the sale, which I shared with the owner of the field. But the torc is more than just money for me. It is something I have saved for the country. People ask me, “Now that you found something so amazing, will you stop detecting?” But I still find brooches and coins interesting. Just like a fisherman who catches a big fish, I will keep searching for more treasures.

Sleeping is one of my favorite things about traveling, but I don’t talk about it much because I feel a bit guilty. When my friends tell me about their busy trips with many activities, like visiting museums and hiking, I just smile and don’t say much. What would they think if they knew that I like to take long naps in the afternoon and enjoy lazy mornings in bed? Sleeping better is one of the nice things about traveling. 
When I went to Mexico’s Yucatán coast when I was in my early 20s, I was surprised that I slept more than 12 hours most days. There were many loud birds nearby, but it didn’t bother me. Far from home, with new smells and sounds, I could sleep deeply and have many dreams. Without alarm clocks and responsibilities, I could sleep easily. 
I think sleep is part of traveling, not just a break from it. When we travel, we see, hear, and smell new things. All these new experiences fill our minds. It makes sense that sleep feels different when we are traveling. 
People often worry about jet lag, but I think the problems I have after long trips are more about getting used to new places than just time changes. For example, in Trinidad, people wake up very early to avoid the heat, feel tired around 10 a.m. when the sun is strong, and then feel active again in the cool evening. Even though Trinidad is only one hour ahead of New York, it takes me days to get used to their sleep patterns. When I finally do, I feel like I belong there. 
I remember one afternoon in Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. I had a big lunch with new friends in an apartment with a view of the blue Caribbean Sea. After eating, we all felt sleepy and started to relax. One by one, my friends went to lie down on hammocks and sofas. I understood why they had so many pillows. I took some pillows too and followed their example. I had heard about the Latin American custom of the siesta, but that day I really experienced it. I shared not just sleep, but a part of Dominican life. 
Travel sleep is special because I remember it. In a new place, I enjoy the different smells, textures, and sounds while I sleep. If enjoying every moment of travel is what makes a good traveler today, then sleeping is one of the best ways to do that. Maybe I should not feel embarrassed about my love for sleep and tell my friends that travel sleep is an important part of traveling too.

The woman looked at herself in the mirror. “What do you think? Please be honest.” Mia picked up a nice hat with a soft layer of fabric and a silk bow. “I think this one looks best on you,” she said politely. The woman wrinkled her nose and made a funny face. “But it is so boring,” she said. “Every other woman will wear a hat like that at my daughter’s wedding. This pretty little hat will make me stand out.” She touched the small red and black top hat on her head. “Yes,” she said, “this is the one I want.” 
Mia smiled and agreed that the woman would stand out at the wedding. She thought about her own daughter, Jen. It was Jen’s thirtieth birthday today, and they were having a family party. Mia was excited to see Jen, Dan, and Luke. She was also looking forward to meeting Jen’s friend, Tattie. They did not know anything about Tattie. Mia’s husband, Jeff, had quickly asked, “What kind of name is that?” “It’s short for Tatiana,” Mia replied. “I think it’s nice.” “It sounds strange,” Jeff said. He did not like anything that seemed too fancy. He also thought Mia was too polite. He would have told the woman in the shop that she was choosing the wrong hat. 
An hour later, Mia closed her shop and went home. It took her only forty seconds to walk from work to her house. Four years ago, when Luke, their youngest child, left home, Mia decided to turn the empty barn next to their house into a space for her business. Jeff was not sure. “Do you really think people want to buy hats?” he asked. Mia knew that many friends had trouble finding the right hat for special occasions. She was right. From the first day, after Jen helped her make a website, Mia’s Hats was a success. Women came from far away to her shop in Little Pelham. In a friendly place, she let them try on many hats until they found the right one. She encouraged them to bring their outfits so they could match everything. Recently, she also started selling handbags and jewelry.

Lawrence Okoye has moved from London to Atlanta, and he is thinking about his amazing sports journey. He is confident but surprised by how far he has come. He went from being in the Olympic final for discus throwing to possibly playing American football. Lawrence has never played American football before, but he might be chosen for a big team in the USA.
In Atlanta, he is learning about his new position in football. It is surprising that a 21-year-old from London could be picked for a big American sports team. But Lawrence likes to prove people wrong. He was offered a place at Oxford University to study law, but he decided to train for discus throwing instead. After just 20 months of training, he became the fourth-best discus thrower in the world.
Lawrence came to Atlanta to train for discus throwing, but he also thought about American football. He decided to try it when he arrived in the USA. He read about the NFL trials in Atlanta and applied to join, even though he had never played before. When asked if he was nervous about being tested with experienced players, he said he was not nervous at all. He believes in his abilities.
Lawrence did well in the tests and was chosen as one of the best players. He felt proud when he heard this. However, he knows he has no experience in football. He believes that if he works hard, he can succeed. He is not worried about whether he will be selected. Many people think he will be chosen, but he is not too concerned.
Lawrence has learned from his past experiences, including a disappointing Olympic final where he came last. He is happy that he qualified for the final with a great last throw. He knows that sports can be unpredictable. 
Playing in the NFL can earn him a lot of money, so he has changed from rugby to athletics and now to American football. Some people think he should focus on just one sport. Lawrence understands this but wants to follow his dreams. If football does not work out, he can always return to discus throwing, which he loves. He believes every choice he has made is a good one.

I woke up on a plane flying east. It was daylight outside. I looked out the window and saw a big, empty land with dark brown and green colors. It was mid-September, but it was still summer in Siberia. I could not see any people. The view was beautiful with mountains, rivers, and forests. 
My neighbor woke up and smiled at me. “Good morning, Robert,” he said with a slow Russian accent. His name was Sergei. He was a salesman from Moscow. He was going to sell safety clothes to miners. His English was not very good, and my Russian was not good either. But I used a dictionary to tell him I was going to Magadan in Siberia. I had a one-way ticket because I wanted to ride my bicycle back to England. 
“But, Robert,” he said, “there is no road from Magadan. You cannot ride a bicycle.” I told him I thought there was a road, but not many people used it. “Alone?” he asked. “No, I will ride with a friend named Al.” “Just one friend?” he asked. “Yes, just one,” I said. Sergei looked worried and pointed outside, saying “Holodna” (cold). I tried to show him with my hands that I had warm clothes, but I didn’t tell him I was on a tight budget. Most of my clothes were cheap. I was not sure if they would keep me warm, especially my big over-trousers that I bought for £10.
This all started in a lecture hall in Scotland. The hall was full of tired students. The teacher was talking, and I was thinking about a question. Should I ask my friend Al to go on a trip? I decided to write him a note: “Hi Al, Do you want to cycle across the Karakorum Highway between Pakistan and China this summer? Rob.” I passed the note to Al, who was sitting in front of me. He read it, thought for a moment, and wrote back, “OK.” 
Now, six years later, I was going to meet Al in Siberia. I had been working as a geography teacher. The job was sometimes hard, but it was also exciting and I had long holidays to go on adventures. I had visited Al twice during these holidays. After our bike ride in Pakistan, Al wanted to cycle around the world. He was taking on bigger challenges every time. This trip around the world was his biggest challenge yet. Sometimes he thought it was too hard, but I admired him. He was having an amazing adventure and facing new challenges every day. He was proving to everyone that he could do it, and it made him feel alive.

In The Red Bull Air Race, twelve pilots race through tall pylons that are between 15 and 25 metres high. They make sharp turns and do loops at speeds of up to 370 km per hour. I was invited to see what it feels like to fly in this race. 
An hour before my flight, I had to sign two forms. The first form said I was healthy, and the second said I would empty my pockets. Small objects can be dangerous during the flight. I learned that I needed to keep looking at the horizon. The pilot would tell me where to look. I also had to promise to relax and enjoy the view when I was upside down.
Half an hour before the flight, I had a safety talk. I was told not to touch anything. When we started to move down the runway, I was very nervous. I had to keep my legs up and not touch the important pedals and switches. I knew I should relax, but I could not. 
Dario, the pilot, and I were in a very fast acrobatic plane called the Zivko Edge 540. The plane took off, and we quickly turned to the right. I felt the air push out of my lungs. I looked at the horizon and tensed my body. For a moment, I felt much heavier than normal. Then we flew straight again. We turned left and went down fast, feeling my stomach drop. 
We were very close to the ground, flying between two pylons at 400 km per hour. I was excited but also scared. For two minutes, I got to fly the plane, but my hands were shaking. Dario asked me something, but I could not hear him. Instead, he did a barrel roll, turning the plane upside down. He asked if I was okay, and I said yes. He then did a loop, flying up and over in a circle. 
Many people would find this fun, like riding a rollercoaster. But I thought it was too much. At the top of the loop, I heard a voice saying, “Relax, look up.” I looked up and saw fields. The flight lasted 10 minutes. It was easier than what the pilots do in the race. When we landed, Dario ate sandwiches, but I could not eat for hours. That night, I dreamed about flying in loops over and over again. 
**Questions:**
1. How many pilots race in The Red Bull Air Race?
2. What do pilots have to do with their pockets before the flight?
3. What should you look at during the flight?
4. What is the name of the plane the pilot and the writer flew in?
5. How long did the flight last?

Doug Allan films wild animals in cold places. If you have seen videos of polar bears in a nature documentary, he probably filmed them. He likes it when it is -18°C. Allan trained as a marine biologist and a diver. Diving was his first love, and he learned how to survive in cold places. His big chance came when a TV crew came to Antarctica, where he was working, to make a wildlife documentary. He helped the crew find different places to film. After 48 hours, he realized that being a wildlife cameraman was perfect for him because it included travel, adventure, and underwater work.
Now, he is a famous cameraman and has worked on many big TV wildlife shows. When he started 35 years ago, not many people had been to Antarctica. There were people who filmed coral, elephants, and chimpanzees. He became known as the "cold man." The technology for filming was very simple back then. He says it is easier to film today. In the past, if you filmed something, you had to remember it. Now, with digital cameras, you can see what you filmed right away. Before, you had to think about what shots you needed and what you missed. Film was very expensive, so you filmed less. Now, you can have too much footage.
Allan says his experience in cold places is very important. He feels comfortable on sea ice. He does get cold toes, but the poles are healthy places with no leeches, diseases, or mosquitoes. Wildlife filming has many successes, but also failures. Once, he was in the Orkneys to film kittiwakes, but he could not tell which birds they were.
Recently, he got permission to film in Kong Karls Land, a group of islands in the Arctic Ocean. This place is home to polar bears and is very dangerous. In April, it is usually -32°C, and the wind is strong. Carrying cameras in deep snow is very hard. After walking for five hours a day and watching polar bear dens for 23 days, he only saw one mother bear and her cub. On the 24th day, he felt like he was part of the bear world. He had to move around to stay warm. After watching for five hours, he saw a quick glimpse of a bear. The camera was ready, and he focused on the viewfinder. After a few seconds, he saw a black nose, then a bear's head. The bear came out and rested in front of the hole. She looked at him but did not care. Just then, she slid down the slope, and two cubs appeared at the den entrance. It was their first view of the world, and it was very exciting.
Now, Allan wants to make his own film about climate change in the Arctic. He wants to talk to the people who live there and see how it affects them. He believes he can make an amazing documentary.

In 2004, Pen Hadow was the first person to walk to the North Pole alone without getting more supplies. He had to swim in very cold water, fight frostbite, and deal with polar bears. Eight months later, he also reached the South Pole. Now, he is back in the Arctic, getting ready for a new trip that is even bigger. Explorers like Pen are confident and strong. This time, Pen and two friends will go on a three-month journey of 1,000 kilometers to the North Pole. They will measure the ice's thickness and density. No one has done this before, and the results will be very important for scientists. This work will show how global warming is affecting the ice in the polar areas.
Pen was prepared for this job since he was a child. His father’s old nanny, who worked for a famous polar explorer, helped him become strong. She sent him outside in bad weather with very few clothes. His father also loved adventures in cold places, and Pen became very strong. 
Pen is married to Mary, who loves horses. She helps him with his polar guide business. Mary says she worries more about him when he is at home because he thinks about the Arctic. For fun, she once raced against him in a mountain event, and she finished an hour before him. Pen and Mary live in the countryside with their two children. 
Pen says it is harder to be away from his children this time. When he last went to the Arctic, his son was one year old and his daughter was five. He told his son to take care of his mother and sister, but this made his son very worried. Pen thinks it was not fair to say that. This time, he plans to have little contact with them while he is away because he does not want to remind them how far he is.
Before he leaves, Pen is getting ready and checking his equipment carefully. He says that when he is on the ice, it is hard to fix things. He will be with Ann Daniels, a top polar explorer, and Martin Hartley, a photographer. They will have a team of six people to help them with supplies.
Pen is also thinking about his age. He will be 47 soon and feels he has not trained enough. He is worried about what he will have to do. Pen believes that this trip is important for science. He says that reaching the North Pole was a personal goal, but this time, scientists will use the information they collect. He wants to involve many people in understanding what is happening in the Arctic Ocean. He feels that their skills are now very important and useful.

"I took a year off. What was I going to do? Being a successful Olympian is amazing. I had the chance to do more writing, TV work, and speak to businesses and schools. Even though these activities were great, I wanted to compete again. I wanted to stay in shape to try for the Olympics if I felt that way again. So, I joined marathons and triathlons. That should have been enough, but I kept thinking about Ben Fogle’s invitation: ‘Do you want to row across the Atlantic with me?’ I have always loved rowing and the feeling of the boat moving through the water. I missed that feeling, but I wasn’t ready to train every day. Still, I wanted some competition. I asked my rowing friends if they wanted to join the race, but they were not very excited. I knew that if I entered the race, I would want to win. Would rowing with Ben help me win? No. But being an underdog with no pressure was interesting. I contacted Ben. He was going to join the race anyway and had found the money for the entry fee and a boat. This made the race feel real. We talked about the costs; the boat and equipment would cost £70,000 – a lot of money. We thought we had a good chance, but it would still take work. I also had to think about losing money because I would be away from home. Speaking at business conferences is one of the best ways to earn money after being a professional athlete. It feels good that people are interested. But I find it hard to talk about my past without a new goal. Joining the race would mean I was doing something again: rowing across the Atlantic. I learned a lot while planning this adventure, but one big lesson was to appreciate the easy life of a full-time athlete. My training for the Olympics was hard, but it was simple. I trained almost every day, but the program was set, and there were doctors and dieticians. I was worried about what people would think of me racing with a TV presenter. I thought it might look like I just wanted to be on TV. But my worries went away as we prepared. The Atlantic Rowing Race is about more than just rowing. It is also about the mind. Ben had done tough challenges, but he could not row well. I was surprised by how little he knew about rowing, and he was surprised by my lack of patience. I could have been more patient, but I needed to tell Ben how much he needed to improve. I should have known what to expect when I agreed to race with him."

A little over a year ago, I left my job to work with huskies in the Arctic Circle in northern Finland. I was 26 years old and wanted a change. I dreamed of cold, snowy places because I was tired of the busy life in London. I found a small company run by Anna McCormack and her husband, Pasi Ikonen, in Finnish Lapland. They hired me as a husky dog handler for the winter season. From December to February, they take tourists on sled rides pulled by huskies across the snow. They started with six dogs, but now they have more than 100. They also have a second place called the 'wilderness farm,' which is simple and does not have running water. They told me I could join their team for three months, but the work would be hard. I started packing right away.
**November 6, London**  
On my flight, I looked at a page with pictures of more than 100 huskies. I was supposed to remember their names, but I felt nervous. I put the page down and looked out the window. I thought about how spring moves north, but I was seeing winter coming south, with rivers freezing.
**November 7, Helsinki and Hetta**  
The bus ride north was what I expected. We drove through dark forests with snow on the trees, stopping for reindeer. I arrived at the farm after dark. As soon as I got in, Anna gave me a pair of boots and sent me outside into the cold. She asked if I wanted to start working right away. I followed the sound of barking and found the dogs. Three people were busy getting the huskies ready for sleds. The dogs were very excited and wanted to run. I tried to introduce myself, but everyone was too busy. I petted one of the quieter dogs. Someone told me to get in the sled, and I almost fell in. Then we started moving into the dark with only a headlamp for light.
**November 15, Hetta**  
I quickly learned how to be a husky guide, but first, Anna asked me if I was useful. I didn’t know how to answer. I had never driven a snowmobile or used an axe. Finally, someone asked if I had a driving license, and I said yes. I learned the basics of dog-sledding quickly: lean into the corners, use both feet to stop, and hold on to the handlebar. But other tasks were hard. Feeding and giving water to the dogs was difficult in the cold. Water would freeze quickly, so we made a 'soup' of meat in hot water for the dogs. By the end of my first week, I was tired and my muscles hurt from pulling heavy sleds and being pulled by excited huskies. But I felt proud. I emailed my friends, saying, "I can chop with an axe, hammer a nail, and use a saw. In the snow."

On that day, Radcliffe ran very fast and crossed the finish line. Many reporters came to talk about her amazing run. They said her time was good enough to compete in the men's marathon at the world championships in Paris. The journalists asked her about a special treatment called emu oil. This oil was recommended by Cathy Freeman, an Olympic gold medalist, to help Radcliffe heal from an accident when she ran into a bike while training.
Radcliffe said she did not really understand how big her achievement was at that moment. She thought it was just what she was supposed to do that day. She and her team decided not to set any limits on what they could do. During the race, her husband and coach, Gary Lough, was in a car with her team, listening to the radio. Gerard Hartmann, her physiotherapist, was with him. After 16 kilometers, Radcliffe's agent worried that she might not be able to keep running so fast. Hartmann was angry about this, but he understood that people who did not know how fit she was might think it was risky.
With 800 meters left, Radcliffe thought she could finish in under 2 hours and 16 minutes if she ran the last part quickly. She had already run 41 kilometers very fast, but she still sprinted the last part in 2 minutes and 25 seconds. At the finish, she thought, "I can run faster than that." The race director, Dave Bedford, said he never thought anyone would run that fast for a long time. Radcliffe thought, "I will come back and do it again next year."
After the race, everyone wanted to know how Radcliffe, who ran in a strange way, beat the skilled East African runners. Hartmann worked with Radcliffe for many weeks, helping her with her training. He said he had worked with many Olympic medalists, but Radcliffe could take a lot of pain. He had to work very hard on her muscles and sometimes felt pain in his hands after.
Hartmann traveled 13 hours from Ireland to Radcliffe's training place in France. When he arrived, her husband shouted, "Gerard, you're 15 minutes late, Paula's waiting." There was no time for greetings or tea. Radcliffe was ready for a two-hour training session. She always pushed him to work harder, which is why she was so good.
Hartmann spent so much time with Radcliffe that other athletes became upset. When asked why no one has come close to her record, Radcliffe said, "I trained very hard, but some people are more talented." She thought Mary Keitany, a two-time London marathon winner, might break her record. Radcliffe believed that some runners focus more on racing against others than on improving themselves.
She explained that always pushing herself, even when she was winning, helped her run fast. Radcliffe did not know it at the time, but that marathon was the best she would ever run. However, she inspired many women to start long-distance running. 
**Questions:**
1. What did Radcliffe do on that day?
2. Who recommended the emu oil to Radcliffe?
3. How did Radcliffe feel about her achievement after the race?
4. Who was in the car with Gary Lough during the race?
5. What did Radcliffe think she could do with 800 meters left?
6. Why did Hartmann say Radcliffe was special compared to other athletes?
7. What did Radcliffe inspire many women to do?

When my first cooking show, In Search of Perfection, came out, I was not sure how people would like it. There was a lot of talk about a food ‘revolution’ in Britain, and I thought we made a good series that added something new. But I still worried: would people like a way of cooking that included not just techniques but also history and science? I watched the first show feeling both happy and scared. I didn’t need to worry. The show became very successful and led to many other interesting projects, including a book about my restaurant. 
In each project, I felt like I was on a journey, whether into the past or into cooking techniques. I wrote several books in a series called ‘Perfection’, each one with its own TV show. In these books, the journey was often about traveling, with passports and suitcases. The latest book is called In Search of Total Perfection. In it, you will travel around the world to meet amazing people, like a man who makes golden pasta that tastes better than any other. These people have spent many years trying to reach their own idea of perfection.
Perfection is different for everyone. Even choosing which dishes to include in the series was hard. I knew some people would be upset if their favorite dish was not included. I could imagine people asking, “Where is steak and kidney pie and bread and butter pudding?” But after a long meeting, the TV team and I made a list that had something for everyone. This showed me that everyone has their own idea of perfection, based on their feelings and memories.
Even though the book is called ‘Perfection’, I knew I would not say the recipes were the best. I believed that by using my skills and talking to food producers, chefs, and customers, I could find out what makes these dishes good. The dictionary says ‘perfection’ means being perfect, but it also means improving through practice. Trying new ideas and changing them until you have something special.
The TV show let me explore many foods, people, and places I had never seen before. I was excited to learn about food and memories because I started my career in the same way. Finding the best ingredients took me all over the world. I had many adventures, like visiting a canning factory that was using the wrong tomatoes and going to a dairy farm that was not good enough for filming. I even hand-milked a cow and used dry ice to make ice cream, cooked chicken in a hospital machine, and almost burned my house trying to make a real Neapolitan pizza.

We were still far from Marrakech when the van made a loud noise, went off the road into a field, and stopped. John got out and opened the front of the van. He looked at the engine for a long time with his hands in his pockets. He looked like he knew what he was doing. “Actually, I don’t know what I’m doing,” he said after a while, and he and Mum started to laugh. Bea was worried. “We can’t stay here forever,” she said. The field was big and had only grass and many flowers, like poppies and daisies. “No, we can’t stay here forever,” I said too, because it was better to agree with Bea. We got back into the van and waited for Mum and John to stop laughing. We sat by the road and watched John walk away to find someone who could help with the van. Mum lay down on the grass. “Tell us a story,” she said. Bea lay down next to her. “Go on, tell us a story.” So I told them about how the day before we left London, I heard two birds talking. I told them what the birds talked about: breadcrumbs, other birds, the weather, and an argument over a worm. “That’s silly, no one understands bird language,” Bea said. My eyes felt wet. “I do.” But I didn’t sound sure. “Liar,” Bea said. I felt embarrassed. How could I be lying if I remembered everything? I thought about asking Mum, but she was asleep in the sun. 
John came back with three Moroccan boys who helped us push the van to the hotel. Bea didn’t want to get out. The boys waved and smiled at her through the back windows. We followed John into a café. It was not far from where our van was parked. “It’s a hotel,” John whispered. “It might be a bit expensive.” “We’ll just have some tea,” Mum said, and we sat in the shade. The tea was made from mint leaves and was very sweet. Mum looked into the pot. “It’s like syrup,” she said. We stayed at the café all day while John looked at the engine. “It’s a miracle it got us this far,” he said when it started to get dark. Mum took out blankets and made a bed for us in the hotel garden. It felt nice to sleep on the ground. “I will have to get us towed into Marrakech,” John said. 
Half an hour later, we were in a truck watching our van being pulled behind. At first, Bea didn’t want to move, so John picked her up and put her in the truck. Now she sat in the front with the driver. I kept thinking about how we would get home now that our van had to be pulled everywhere. I thought it might be easier to take a boat straight to London. Then I must have fallen asleep.

Lucy was at a welcome party in a hotel ballroom. She was talking to two other pianists who were also at the Prague Classical Music Festival. One was a guy from Tokyo, and the other was a girl from Europe. Lucy didn’t hear her name well because it was noisy. They were both older than Lucy by about ten years. They spoke good English and talked about the music they were playing and their travels. 
“I think I’m going to Tanglewood this summer,” Lucy said. It sounded impressive, but she didn’t really want to go. She didn’t want to do many things that took her away from school, like concerts and competitions. Because of this, she wasn’t officially enrolled in school anymore. Instead, she worked with tutors from the University of San Francisco. 
Lucy didn’t even want to come to the Prague Festival. Only fifteen pianists her age were chosen from many applicants, and she was one of them. There was a party, and her dad bought her a white-gold necklace with an L pendant to celebrate. Her little brother Gus dreamed about being at the festival one day. Lucy’s teacher, Grace Chang, took her out for a special dinner to plan her music pieces. The funny thing was, Lucy hadn’t applied to the festival. Her mom filled out the form and sent in a CD. “I didn’t want you to be sad if you didn’t get in,” her mom said. Lucy thought her mom didn’t want to give her a chance to say no. 
The guy from Tokyo leaned forward and asked, “Tanglewood?” 
“Yeah.” 
“How old are you?” 
“Fifteen.” 
He looked at the girl, who said, “Wow.” Lucy didn’t mean to show off. It was hard to know when to share her achievements and when to be quiet. “It’s just part of this new youth program they are trying…” 
“Excuse me,” the girl said, looking away as if she saw someone she needed to talk to. The guy from Tokyo stayed. “Have you ever been to Japan?” He had long hair, like many musicians, to show they were cool. 
“Once, when I was about eight.” He started to reply when Lucy's grandfather came to her. “Lucy, let me introduce you to someone.” He took her arm and pulled her away from the conversation. “And don’t get too friendly with the competition.” 
“They're not the competition.” 
“Everyone is the competition.” 
Her grandfather took her around the room and made her talk to important people. Lucy smiled and nodded a lot, understanding only part of what was said.
